channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024080711
item.description:
Report X-2024080711

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Aug 8th, a package was noticed during the PM sort to be emitting a small amount of smoke and had a burning smell. After opening the package they discovered one of the smaller packages in side had burned through, causing scorch marks on other inner containers as well as a burned hole in the inner support material. The package contained cellphones, other lithium batteries as well as misc phone related accessories. The fire had burned itself out by then and the package was isolated to ensure no further conflagration occured. No injuries were reported. After the package had cooled down it was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being held pending further investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024080400
item.description:
Report X-2024080400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: LORTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading process, the trailer discovered a package containing hazardous materials positioned beneath several heavy packages. This situation led to one of the bottles being crushed and losing its sealing cap, resulting in a spill of the contents. Consequently, the outer box sustained damage, and the other bottles were contaminated due to the leakage.2 BOTTLES DAMAGE AND THE ENTIRE CONTENTS SPILL

item.title: Report E-2024080148
item.description:
Report E-2024080148

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discover a pail staged on a pallet slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a nail from the pallet the pail was staged on had punctured the bottom of the pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

item.title: Report X-2024072430
item.description:
Report X-2024072430

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-07T15:13:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: package was found by a belt manager leaking. The package was shipped without inner packing. This is an ongoing issue with this particular shipper. There is never any inner packing to protect the material inside. Taping of the caps could help this issue as the caps become loos in transit.
